Race.SpecificTitle: Member of School Board -- District 5, City of Monroe
Member of School Board -- District 6, City of Monroe
Member of School Board -- District 7, City of Monroe
Mayor -- Town of Sterlington
Road Lighting District No. Four -- $25 Service Charge Renewal - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Four Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Four of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $25.00, plus a collection charge of $1.25 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a renewal of an existing service charge, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $4,750.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Forty-Four -- $90 Service Charge - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Forty-Four Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Forty-Four of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $90.00, plus a collection charge of $4.50 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge representing a total increase of $10.50 over the present annual service and collection charges that expire in 2018, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $3,870.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Forty-Five -- $80 Service Charge Renewal - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Forty-Five Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Forty-Five of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $80.00, plus a collection charge of $4.00 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a renewal of an existing service charge, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $3,920.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Forty-Eight -- $60 Service Charge - PJ - 10 Yrs.

Road Lighting District No. Forty-Eight Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Forty-Eight of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $60.00, plus a collection charge of $3.00 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $2,040.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Forty-Nine -- $60 Service Charge - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Forty-Nine Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Forty-Nine of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of not more than $60.00, plus a collection charge of $3.00 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019, and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new service charge, and the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the first year will be approximately $3,420.00?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Richwood -- 20.69 Mills Continuation - M&BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Richwood Proposition
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Richwood, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to be authorized to levy and collect up to twenty and sixty-nine hundredths (20.69) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Town, said mills to represent a 0.69 mills increase over the 20.00 mills authorized to be levied through the year 2018 and which is currently being levied at 20.22 mills, pursuant to an election held on November 4, 2008 (an estimated $143,998.79 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purposes of maintaining the police department and operating the recreation facilities in the Town?
